title: Eight top plug-in hybrids for $40,000 or less; The cheapest is $26,800â€”not including tax credits
text:
1. 2022 Ford Escape SE Plug-in Hybrid

Starting price: $35,190Electric range: 37 miles (520 miles total)Hybrid mode fuel economy: 40 mpg city/highway combined

The Ford F Escape SE Plug-in Hybrid is a crossover with seating for five and good cargo room. It's only available with front-wheel drive, but both the hybrid and gas versions do offer all-wheel drive. Standard features include dual-zone automatic climate control and the SYNC 3 infotainment system with a 6-speaker audio system.

2. 2022 Hyundai Tucson Plug-in Hybrid

Starting price: $35,400Electric range: 33 miles (420 miles total)Hybrid mode fuel economy: 35 mpg city/highway combined

The Hyundai HYMTF Tucson Plug-in Hybrid is all-new this year with standard all-wheel drive and sharp, modern exterior styling. It's available in a choice of two trims with good standard features. These include an 8-way power driver's seat, heated front seats, Apple AAPL CarPlay, and Android Auto.

3. 2022 Hyundai Santa Fe Plug-in Hybrid

Starting price: $40,000Electric range: 31 miles (440 miles total)Hybrid mode fuel economy: 33 mpg city/highway combined

Technically, with a starting price of $40,000, the Hyundai Santa Fe Plug-in Hybrid doesn't qualify for this list, but don't let that measly dollar keep you from considering this SUV. This Santa Fe comes standard with all-wheel drive and puts out 261 combined horsepower. It has a spacious, upscale interior with features like a 12.3-inch digital instrument cluster, heated seats, and wireless CarPlay/Android Auto integration.

4. 2022 Hyundai Ioniq Plug-in Hybrid

Starting price: $26,800Electric range: 29 miles (620 miles total)Hybrid mode fuel economy: 52 mpg city/highway combined

The Hyundai Ioniq Plug-in Hybrid is a roomy compact car that has generous cargo space. It's available in a choice of three trims with standard features that include dual-zone climate control, heated front seats, and an 8-inch infotainment touchscreen with wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto.

5. 2022 Kia Niro Plug-In Hybrid

Starting price: $29,590Electric range: 26 miles (560 miles total)Hybrid mode fuel economy: 46 mpg city/highway combined

The Kia KR:000270 Niro Plug-In Hybrid is a front-wheel-drive crossover with sporty styling across a range of three trims. Standard features include an 8-inch infotainment touchscreen with wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto, dual-zone automatic climate control, and a 6-speaker audio system.

You might like: The pros and cons of electric cars

6. 2022 Toyota Prius Prime

Starting price: $28,670Electric range: 25 miles (640 miles total)Hybrid mode fuel economy: 54 mpg city/highway combined

The Toyota TM Prius Prime, the plug-in version of the well-known hybrid, is available in a choice of three trims. In addition to great fuel economy, the Prius Prime also has great flexibility for cargo thanks to its hatchback design.

7. 2022 Mitsubishi Outlander PHEV

Starting price: $36,995Electric range: 24 miles (320 miles total)Hybrid mode fuel economy: 26 mpg city/highway combined

The Mitsubishi MMTOF Outlander PHEV is a roomy crossover that seats five people with up to 30.4 cubic feet for cargo behind the second row. It has an 8-inch infotainment touchscreen with Apple CarPlay and Android Auto. All-wheel drive is standard.

Also see: 10 top hybrids for less than $30,000

8. 2022 Subaru Crosstrek Hybrid

Starting price: $36,345Electric range: 17 miles (480 miles total)Hybrid mode fuel economy: 35 mpg city/highway combined

Yes, the Subaru FUJHY Crosstrek Hybrid is a plug-in despite not saying so in its name. This versatile crossover has standard all-wheel drive, making it great for those who live in wintry climates. It also has a durable interior that can stand up to the mishaps of family life or outdoor adventuring.
